In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is how you can write the `clean_column` function in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]+" => "_")
end
```
This function first converts the column name to lower case using the `lowercase` function. Then it removes any leading or trailing whitespaces using `strip`. It replaces all spaces and hyphens with underscores by applying `replace` function, where regular expression `"[\s-]+"` is used to match one or more whitespace characters (spaces or hyphens) and replace them with an underscore. The result of these operations is then returned from the function.
